readingLevel.explanation: The text maintains an accessible narrative style while introducing essential, complex historical vocabulary (e.g., 'secede,' 'plantations,' 'Confederacy,' 'Thirteenth Amendment,' 'Reconstruction Era'). Abstract concepts like economic dependence and political division are explained using clear analogies ('much like a great argument tearing a family in two'). Sentence structures are varied but generally manageable, suitable for upper elementary students (5th grade) who are building historical literacy, or for middle school students (6th-7th grade) requiring foundational review before deeper analysis.

concepts: Ulysses S. Grant and Robert E. Lee

accuracy.reason: The text is highly accurate. All major historical claims regarding the causes of the war (slavery), key leaders, the date and location of the surrender, the generous terms offered by Grant, the ratification of the Thirteenth Amendment, and the economic challenges of the post-war South and freedpeople are supported by verified historical evidence.
verifiedFacts: The main reason for the Civil War was the issue of slavery, driven by the use of enslaved people in the South [⁽¹⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQGOHMIpSIr75VG295lpLQp-RIIykTyi4HwXIt34RSnFuU-Yfvqz8pkCKNzQbg7HLOBQkzaa5aIoVfMqxKZLXcdbRYRNLOYv9RbO_XiKv1vDvD7hQjQojFUcm5sqAwYSPA==), [⁽²⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQHYYnHELh70Q-rwqhFCwp7eR_u3VdrBT0KAecX9MKZccSLbC3CJ2GiLFE_2UCj_RdomEiGzJfFnGYlw0pNY5zPZLdpoZt24ZLDxLGOrxJINSXlronsX7jJdDg2DyU8CElMGlrTnrjrx9oMI1e3I9Ck6HsCLWhzdU2R3M1tpWwmRJHNT4MgZUIw=), [⁽³⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQFhZ-y4dmlo_4RBk6HW8tZD-polQRnGI4B8LuMfvhZrudEvD660wJWpiszRf7m8E1VP-BKxxA85PLZxnFu6j7w4OqycyGNOGreA50XQAkoGN_kKlNrehZnZpQxssmW4ToYGlyR8-TpKkkYL), [⁽⁴⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQFQM4OGC3dKMLA2EdrrSvEaeTsoiWwBPpFc-3F69U18dyjNfFtq3aWLbSLBd3NYpqk1ibTJFLJnJM85xJN_E8qKE4L8V9b-3hAw1Kkn0AhbMHWSsHj7EVJdaTO4bSHrusgwFZJcnFArg5-ckmhBJhCNbPUu5s4CKF4iwZ8=).

The Southern economy was heavily dependent on enslaved labor for cultivating crops like cotton on large plantations [⁽³⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQFhZ-y4dmlo_4RBk6HW8tZD-polQRnGI4B8LuMfvhZrudEvD660wJWpiszRf7m8E1VP-BKxxA85PLZxnFu6j7w4OqycyGNOGreA50XQAkoGN_kKlNrehZnZpQxssmW4ToYGlyR8-TpKkkYL), [⁽⁴⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQFQM4OGC3dKMLA2EdrrSvEaeTsoiWwBPpFc-3F69U18dyjNfFtq3aWLbSLBd3NYpqk1ibTJFLJnJM85xJN_E8qKE4L8V9b-3hAw1Kkn0AhbMHWSsHj7EVJdaTO4bSHrusgwFZJcnFArg5-ckmhBJhCNbPUu5s4CKF4iwZ8=), [⁽⁵⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQFvLbPs_8-PM4rBLHoOC4EXWDvkf_1kWBHM1dPGcj9DAiHZCyLMPzTbjKfrjKzYfnoGfb5YJJ8Qi6HnfNG-nk4qm2Yq9YKbmwqaAT2NohmkUsPqSCo2jUaFVHXeER7x__VItNDrzkL3FRvTosC7tOh2h51qkhk2qNMES8HqPrBKUaM8vqNbUfd9aHdQJIvv_5PeyWbD4o5a1IAqaBY6FCgQ), [⁽⁶⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQGt8ViuRazKU1r353uxatD8RMGxpRt6J_CxJoZw15T_rClcFR2KYVg9Dj5lJkjam5sLIB_lp8yJi7eeLfvdupiiG3Hczv-JfgYPNUORnR7Kjuu4_auMXmfkz1186_xd5N8u46A8bFQ7_JfPld072CaPEQ==), [⁽⁷⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQECymhGpMNhj8GI6uZfM6WZxDYipQWM6t1eiX1s2NI1VJPY5GeHzcruyVb7pnCC6R_4ypE4MB7rOZiUEO_-Ymbx_dLcVj94YzMicpDjw5Lx2khWIWZcn-bjxjJuxHaQ8G1X4xL7ZU_ThqVEy0uxPfxSYq53Gmg=).

Eleven southern states seceded to form the Confederate States of America (Confederacy), including South Carolina, Mississippi, Florida, and Texas [⁽⁶⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQGt8ViuRazKU1r353uxatD8RMGxpRt6J_CxJoZw15T_rClcFR2KYVg9Dj5lJkjam5sLIB_lp8yJi7eeLfvdupiiG3Hczv-JfgYPNUORnR7Kjuu4_auMXmfkz1186_xd5N8u46A8bFQ7_JfPld072CaPEQ==), [⁽⁷⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQECymhGpMNhj8GI6uZfM6WZxDYipQWM6t1eiX1s2NI1VJPY5GeHzcruyVb7pnCC6R_4ypE4MB7rOZiUEO_-Ymbx_dLcVj94YzMicpDjw5Lx2khWIWZcn-bjxjJuxHaQ8G1X4xL7ZU_ThqVEy0uxPfxSYq53Gmg=), [⁽⁸⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQHzCYOsoXSLO9tNwlPWewWKZ-ojGxpjPSKc7-GYyN9HLeIjbVp1DsrMrg-J0EBM8A_EL6N22REpOlRuviCqZSmQuoWHr8TiC7yYLuxrNWM_T7p2jGjjlngom_lg908TexrTURSOhz2WcQ==), [⁽⁹⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQFoZwOf4Jx2B9Yg2NBqxrsFauVoNOhvPaJUBaiMrlRbbSy3yLeO_WxKE3GUMAV7Q5OPa_lal4TspX16SgTVCm6Dz8p1ViiZX7Oo8eC0NnkkiMLsDeHBfgERae9Pf47GdA885D1zoTgcDwsBFdEHmv8=), [⁽¹⁰⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQFYxZ7XOptWjHb_ZlRcOa3laBRoQJYwwae-VCGoCVt9ekjBdgEkdT2k1X3otNK7IR_zsC1gejn8jcjyrcBv3y5UFRoCF8bNRHp_mphPUrpTyFlgW_ntUpL9dHVkO3cuTMPsChsQdLqamUM5e3RTpD8O-HqRmGlpuzLh).

The Union was led by President Abraham Lincoln [⁽¹¹⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQEQpC8Zn-3WFrHDyIIy03f-yvDc5Dbj6tEb8ex6eKOcKSgp6OY9z3bsS91zzSXEGIo0CtGLq8oPfXSO7rkH1Z0MQVSRqGzl_CttXZA6dE7_Cp3l9Jx7vcbIaA3CsTaDLfd-maG1ZACccw==), [⁽¹²⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQGHp1Lk9qKmwgR9vDi6l-ZeNCgDirKuTAbplFx3hQWESxqjNtW6K0K47yNEny-IjH_naRzpXsG5hrv3nM8s6ijT3Thu1-WoAHSmI8KvScdi-zguTkha815YKxpumxqzo2Fg4xrQEK1QDqYfakxr6k-mb6mR6z2l), [⁽¹³⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQEoniS3PzwCUVQ28WRih2K883m5K-HQ7_Cs0Krd1xTRHcnwfIqLsnT_8Fm4rr4nulH-rSzYV3xmEDagYxRbxjXYDKNPisEFKE5uH9BO3k4C1_ooivtKBMZwOnnr00j6U6SB94F2NlWE5S_oyvUY9QCq8-bo5AKuHRW-EFs=), [⁽¹⁴⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQFsX5kfw958gxSLtc8NwQ583Em7yqLUBDD8mm6WMJoReGcmAa89rIB3g6pHlxJWNPBWvlCLZK_h-qOGR_s6PAYdYcxyjkzBnSIC12Tw-5aTC4-ybGI1x45WgymXNlznfXSmHtGhz_lnaaKwLW52ivp0lxb0Jjqi2hNhksTZE8wPe3pI36IV_naEeWqTrUbVEcXq), [⁽¹⁵⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQGbychkEq7rv3jCJzBW91Joo0SkA-0QydolvBqToQAXDyzG_8ce-sHgPb0kdfMkd8n6VHT-RcGxGlCLjMUED7MiDU9Hku5ylshhGOnAHtGISWpVKY-CIZO8px68yyYmzQ4LqVWu-XTsNPl-YCLPH1DEXbZ2); the Confederacy was led by President Jefferson Davis [⁽¹⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQGOHMIpSIr75VG295lpLQp-RIIykTyi4HwXIt34RSnFuU-Yfvqz8pkCKNzQbg7HLOBQkzaa5aIoVfMqxKZLXcdbRYRNLOYv9RbO_XiKv1vDvD7hQjQojFUcm5sqAwYSPA==), [⁽²⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQHYYnHELh70Q-rwqhFCwp7eR_u3VdrBT0KAecX9MKZccSLbC3CJ2GiLFE_2UCj_RdomEiGzJfFnGYlw0pNY5zPZLdpoZt24ZLDxLGOrxJINSXlronsX7jJdDg2DyU8CElMGlrTnrjrx9oMI1e3I9Ck6HsCLWhzdU2R3M1tpWwmRJHNT4MgZUIw=), [⁽⁸⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQHzCYOsoXSLO9tNwlPWewWKZ-ojGxpjPSKc7-GYyN9HLeIjbVp1DsrMrg-J0EBM8A_EL6N22REpOlRuviCqZSmQuoWHr8TiC7yYLuxrNWM_T7p2jGjjlngom_lg908TexrTURSOhz2WcQ==), [⁽⁹⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQFoZwOf4Jx2B9Yg2NBqxrsFauVoNOhvPaJUBaiMrlRbbSy3yLeO_WxKE3GUMAV7Q5OPa_lal4TspX16SgTVCm6Dz8p1ViiZX7Oo8eC0NnkkiMLsDeHBfgERae9Pf47GdA885D1zoTgcDwsBFdEHmv8=), [⁽¹⁰⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQFYxZ7XOptWjHb_ZlRcOa3laBRoQJYwwae-VCGoCVt9ekjBdgEkdT2k1X3otNK7IR_zsC1gejn8jcjyrcBv3y5UFRoCF8bNRHp_mphPUrpTyFlgW_ntUpL9dHVkO3cuTMPsChsQdLqamUM5e3RTpD8O-HqRmGlpuzLh).

Confederate General Robert E. Lee surrendered to Union General Ulysses S. Grant on April 9, 1865, at Appomattox Court House in Virginia [⁽¹⁶⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQFkx597i_iPGNuLEvSzFziG5rhilowez56XrQ3O3I1mInm5STZR0bpvGaAEqGniEx1fhjIjDWt6eiF2SYNt4eQLdTu0s5VwKweH_2_y7frxqjLDWL1apDjLW9bOrdKVScCEHPzi96K6LycHfdHvtFrQkBCRKAu-9vdK4yz-zDpa8Xf23Lf3vSL0o-2-7BIC), [⁽¹⁷⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQGShXyDRJS0vmLxFVA1QDlB3nHk6tBd3XZi1V7WgnRp1A17UxrDq0rKI4FWTyESv3sYBJBp2ZS16hGB2LWtIbE67ogYawL6T89YkQhjQIpNwNqZ2Pq08FqDFVNQ-mP7l7y_ppDEbkoLuv2m6E0LfIAHXFhvuCOA2AUqCqZy9q43H9Il7VW4), [⁽¹⁸⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQFaAoB0IEms_fai15KDTs1LPy05Ajp-GWM5Y0R5zvDU8NT9umPCBfSGL3Je0zW8q2XVXgzz0_Y1qHKZIdkIIz57ljm0aldvzNF1qnyRVcycbQLkTC8ySJmjpgSOY1HgE1OGiYRptTU4SsaayN6Jqa6aDmNOMy9iDqh1FxXgAdCoCtWIuBZHjJfhpAD5nfCMuTHWmuEIdhbcE8CowRndFrYe), [⁽¹⁹⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQEAQEpDea2JGFTFnve-KxOdk6msN9oBNP4EsNL5QdnALfbmJIOFe6evMx2tVrK78pvcnkU_v9G4jx8UREneAux-iVvMg93PrCX5q0eY6He4VdlrMR0ZWw3MB5SNDimIcjbTKDPYoPumlVhmqT5STOxeraPq9OHhbPpy4g==).

Grant offered generous surrender terms, allowing soldiers to keep horses/mules for farming and officers to keep their sidearms [⁽²⁰⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQGbS5pmDfTdx9zRAA1iP4jL-Tjxv298jhIX394-Q88ErsjWYG9NrY_Vph51Bax66DNmIxZKE-QFwl5kB-kN1k3cXExmnhTrqKuqWra1uMb2a1CxnM1BMS5zoRs_TGe4q_DWdnxPfCt4yD6NBjmW8GahWJJ6gjnK0A_wWOsftMqjerg=), [⁽²¹⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQESUGYEJr1YTm8uKCJajaPX6UrzvXhgExSTMERvycuN-P8ZZ91a-Zf5i0MpjiMfU97wTvVM-sXZ79-o9SrSGK-ciNuxvqXDjMhg3dYIiM_jLnPE1lane3oVxmUxx0uOst_WtntpjWMdiWFko35bGbq2iSzV_quLPh-Ud2Mj5ZQwJtOOy1iaHFeAGQ==), [⁽²²⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQEN9avLn0cm4h1dQF5lvyOQLwnFhjajdkljgK3k0yhpsN1e5Su7ZJowPaI600P0qNybZl7UZifUWAL4UWEoMTChN9-H0VAL058GeC_lincGYQWQwg-Qa1SAEJCs6VUsVMPZ6KNTofB2KaQOTUyWCH1s_c_a0Haqmfu2u6XciMed).

Mary Todd Lincoln (President Lincoln's wife) was from the border state of Kentucky and had relatives who served in the Confederate army, including three brothers who fought for the Confederacy [⁽²³⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQG8tRkCj00KMGGmfkdZj-YiQgqaKAjoyJj607UUkNZj5HlLJvFciPs1trp9bo60cc3Phbg982AddI12rIpRZK8zTu-lpqZnA4C--zeq7bVGSgry4EHJId_uz7t52qhXG6W9qlLgrt1fFd-NG9OXtBH9vwhXUf53tbsWfONEIbUMw1K6mM-4UTo-5Eh0-A==), [⁽²⁴⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQFRkpGV5zbdGNtQ6CYxukQZUGBZNM0S3ujgMx3PWW2I-YONJN-HZH78YPcEq9CUwhiRKflBUFCsjXuYJBP0nWFri8taTuDQk28BQsiIm-qYtvTXVu5_RyrPLwdyNyaMWf5aaZYrRli5tnU9HbjZWNGD9F0O0-Qzn5Dwwg==), [⁽²⁵⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQFDxEmmi-uiW3LktH9ZiocUskg6Yw9ap5J4dmx6cUGNyNx5AEDfpbyDwPQhk1A2sQTyZKcmd8-iMWsb4Vv3MvcQ8SmgkrdHL9OqF8qDR7nOclHRadkh-om6f6wOj398Nbp6xjkCTfaA2EqaeQQnowlJc5CP9w4fq9rtkVFAk90mNrJjpjTRCcuGeJI=).

The Thirteenth Amendment, which officially abolished slavery across the entire United States, was ratified in December 1865 [⁽²⁶⁾](https://www.google.com/search?q=time+in+Shoalhaven+City+Council,+AU).

The Civil War resulted in massive damage across the South, including destroyed cities, infrastructure (roads/railroads), and the collapse of Confederate banks [⁽²⁷⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQHHXXxZPDSRx32eCOkvPIdaKjsW2ziYMY-VcG0RHBPmrLVcv6ajzpiCTDdLJ2drmxPxjzSyRo6F3V13QEQbRqk0gtru-J54ZyYbojwoD36JRijcWAiCKIwOmkBmh7sSa5ieHTtV0SwBBuYM1hiqBbf4jS-CBSymb8hbChj6CWn_asZi7ZMDfCXHTwzYzXLy5PXNtplMJ1dwDApR), [⁽²⁸⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQGFoeP4TY2-IcZIPGfAKuXvvwPQOnpTyeuqtEqJSaU0uDQDpyXc6saczOgZDFyu8qMweTy4PHoEurdE-QI-D1H5sSdCm_-Jn2PN9kxnXBaVrfx-3kAhq59FjVxjWuIPxxpkXOmnB9mr_v43yMl77Tj0YgUwpdKfEGthn7Y=), [⁽²⁹⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQEcSAX1AzbssDSBhdEvWpjBYNva03xnjPX32lvhA7VNROeoGA3Tz3aDXXpOduJX9oIUqt8raH8cyWN8AmpOuF4v82tt6RwnHuBN-mOGAsO8hS_WjO_RODKRZ9A0NlU7xwNnMSGNNw4-pGq8_rmJC0ErbUOyUHN9iYTcapY=), [⁽³⁰⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQF91-PSQNK7BE33NHiD2qBYa8fPvbFRSZKJnlk9LHx-TwqppP38bc6uYzvG8_vq6H8A1H-rAl79XNE0GMXKHBD5PWuU47Tb7NXcPUCXTAXJ7peMn6FO5yc7QiOhh9wkqjfIxxUGXX_89Z60d7Mb4K312tJAwXpjxp-LZnFHv07KhUo2xEgK), [⁽³¹⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQERh_9S2LHuL7cNjUldWs01b0UtCEnLHpLcoBCaZ0atQB3PoaEmQ3pyMpxWnbKjuss_yHy8GKwH7HmwZIHKhsXoDuGenG-hkIhVS0LFVNWRbjxPboXHGiX1pY1JlU5HHAL7WXa43qw1KNoXkE9nnF1zsdyYp1MmzkwUfThW2NKLRQPoz0hVH0HO3H-L92Svl4HL), [⁽³²⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQHmLRE5Jfkc_4imilJfeKs9QKWrExknnwkmh5fArFsgkCfQUwivyj-RfuLwnMx3hAZ_eJhbAMJQc7u9LcRsVGxaQs9hZuVu-fZkbGSm0ykOTbST6WqQmRBZyLvraIv0rZnYDLvmXx9196XPEs2iztyfBUaf5h0sqsWAHGsyGzlM9-vslFXUQYQf7cOZ8Pf6), [⁽³³⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQHZrcpV1ocmSvhmjHQ1eB4YYDB4BoAbTkPj1AI4TGMGjUWv_shY9fwoVKT6gAogoVkftJ9RlHY4xXEfW56krgv6jtUD5YdnCwl4enNcvyahjmDBQvt-dNpf2L8oct_pU4g8QVyERkFu4NL0Dz_fhM9PZE2Yq-bTU_STZQI=).

Newly freed African Americans (freedpeople) faced severe economic hardship and lacked education, housing, and capital, having been denied these under slavery [⁽³⁴⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQGJYYOPIc10dPWLFdjjrCQzUSVgCnysehE8nkw38Gl3x6fDt1c8hTJvUaxB9IQBauhFDi3AQpYHLiEoJB1qu_40kJfqEfRUx6f5jwQjfB2Y-pOhJFgN5yG0gPzuC8WS9z-GEv31ssahrFF6x3LHN7H10Vg=), [⁽³⁵⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQGz0srYT9AgZnQB59YWPHNWTDNHFzX-nTAcbFvfV1HgDhnGc3UQMDNF2n3cFo5WYrLmWUmezU0XWUsM1jCBUC1CkWWDLprRdra-jxehZ7BE3fBwLmPiUwe3pwyqEkLifcEiEn9wjN8FXWYe-6bumwCcJaX_cHMD9xMuORwvnDJpLiLczPH4ZYooJg3AtKnU), [⁽³⁶⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQESf26Sj5Mc9UT5-4GAlrYd2_E3qT5J61TmNBn_o7kQ9kVXncJ8UZk_UmvmO_GwEWbVgoib1taLalHHRRzCmTBYqs_bYoxU9KhJV8b8alBla0LRplatTFnvg49wloBYqZLzkkenDsIEyOxJBu69e5QW2N7_r_WrhjhuWPE3PORWT4KT6NW3cdWBzx3Afy8s).

The primary goals of the Reconstruction Era included the political reintegration of the Southern states, physical rebuilding, and establishing a new social structure for the newly freed citizens [⁽²⁷⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQHHXXxZPDSRx32eCOkvPIdaKjsW2ziYMY-VcG0RHBPmrLVcv6ajzpiCTDdLJ2drmxPxjzSyRo6F3V13QEQbRqk0gtru-J54ZyYbojwoD36JRijcWAiCKIwOmkBmh7sSa5ieHTtV0SwBBuYM1hiqBbf4jS-CBSymb8hbChj6CWn_asZi7ZMDfCXHTwzYzXLy5PXNtplMJ1dwDApR), [⁽³⁶⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQESf26Sj5Mc9UT5-4GAlrYd2_E3qT5J61TmNBn_o7kQ9kVXncJ8UZk_UmvmO_GwEWbVgoib1taLalHHRRzCmTBYqs_bYoxU9KhJV8b8alBla0LRplatTFnvg49wloBYqZLzkkenDsIEyOxJBu69e5QW2N7_r_WrhjhuWPE3PORWT4KT6NW3cdWBzx3Afy8s), [⁽³⁷⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQFK5mZ5WtalGTNzrOq11MKC8dnJDufT-SBdruoXG1MDshJGukYnhc8m9kqQ1nq7iEpd0jYgfVxbRNAFPFe922iBpC_GWd1DaJ-i9H5QjdCX_ih8rkEuuVq8HjPhd8wn8DmtCOXPC74onP6pnmPyLQ3_LDSmhMJe8Rt0VAZtKKehiDUOsShm7AJrU-5jbk0kkgMjCl-Lq30vtk7AvGAOkg==).

data.originalText:
Title: The Civil War

## Two Countries, One Family: The Fight Over Freedom and Unity

The Civil War was a fight that tore the United States apart, much like a great argument tearing a family in two. For many years, the northern states and the southern states had grown to be very different. These differences led to a terrible war where Americans were fighting against Americans. The main reason for this heartbreaking division was the issue of slavery and who had the power to make laws about it.[⁽¹⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQElcrqnoF-9zvkKNqFPU7BF-6PzP5P54TT9lZZgk-7boG_aujGeRZfm0GDPuvJ0EAyKMbNNZ_gsfQj04O--WeNVJwDSL-82siYcezQ4fH2fq6wxO4T8oxbp_56L7pfJTwR-8A0Q6W7YOtVO8UEDD4dgeGWL7m7hA2vWngBXSX-kiq8xWgIwMDSkvPpQf6CcluuiFg==) [⁽²⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQG4VAAzIQGJ3RtGvn7pYI6M6wdSj0CAFDFkTJ_iP1jOYfPFx2cZX6WYzRVP1Q1mF-v1mXxGS272fDIqcFeHvSt73_s5M74EL0RLig-MMX25WaGaPLgRsKR6sZz6lxCG-xTBNExgeEsQQbAfa7Wk1ItgSjZ4l9ohlxtoaRFgGHOQ)

The most important cause of the war was the use of enslaved people in the South. In the southern states, a vast number of enslaved people—men, women, and children—were forced to work on large farms called plantations. They worked mainly to grow crops like cotton, which made a lot of money for the plantation owners. The[⁽²⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQG4VAAzIQGJ3RtGvn7pYI6M6wdSj0CAFDFkTJ_iP1jOYfPFx2cZX6WYzRVP1Q1mF-v1mXxGS272fDIqcFeHvSt73_s5M74EL0RLig-MMX25WaGaPLgRsKR6sZz6lxCG-xTBNExgeEsQQbAfa7Wk1ItgSjZ4l9ohlxtoaRFgGHOQ) [⁽³⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQHlpu96IRWTV9j2fr4VTm7wZHV1bxguCuqau699bu3UBToxCIjS85PUuhNPrAXRVXKJCezDTqilNibA20cLWhMLl5J_REDNOsjW5O0HpWsF0SjIw4XXednE_cIHO2XQJ2ACuw==) South believed its entire way of life and its economy depended on keeping this system of enslavement. The people who were enslaved were treated like property, not as human beings with rights, and they were forced to work without pay or freedom.

In[⁽¹⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQElcrqnoF-9zvkKNqFPU7BF-6PzP5P54TT9lZZgk-7boG_aujGeRZfm0GDPuvJ0EAyKMbNNZ_gsfQj04O--WeNVJwDSL-82siYcezQ4fH2fq6wxO4T8oxbp_56L7pfJTwR-8A0Q6W7YOtVO8UEDD4dgeGWL7m7hA2vWngBXSX-kiq8xWgIwMDSkvPpQf6CcluuiFg==) the North, however, most states had outlawed slavery. People in the North were increasingly against the practice of owning another person. They believed it was morally wrong. The disagreement grew so loud and angry that it felt like two separate nations were living side-by-side. The southern states worried that the northern states and the national government would try to force them to give up slavery completely.

To protect their way of life, eleven southern states decided to take a drastic step: they chose to secede, or leave, the United States. These states—including South Carolina, Mississippi, Florida, and Texas—formed their own new country called the Confederate States of America, or the Confederacy. This act of leaving the Union is what truly started the war. The Confederacy wanted to be a new, independent country, but the United States government said they were not allowed to leave.[⁽²⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQG4VAAzIQGJ3RtGvn7pYI6M6wdSj0CAFDFkTJ_iP1jOYfPFx2cZX6WYzRVP1Q1mF-v1mXxGS272fDIqcFeHvSt73_s5M74EL0RLig-MMX25WaGaPLgRsKR6sZz6lxCG-xTBNExgeEsQQbAfa7Wk1ItgSjZ4l9ohlxtoaRFgGHOQ) [⁽⁴⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQEKkFoklHH4Ri4cAVlQFgxuQGreVISV1bM5eHD7qIbQ6HI0jLyTUxfB0z529yM9hCp0cTVJzSAFy30m5WtjaM7D7H7Nbm78hUgvxk6hFLcs67rD2EKwY5zDsuNS4hEMgyiTEo1mxKAzbCX4WmG2VPqBPdq0fGXMOAkLHnenEPcfrEs9zK1z5DBkbWx2pA==) [⁽⁵⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQH-uRweQCyStheU-wDqAIYBa1hP5CH3PrqNviwndnAqeCpwt7znbihr83i9GUBKBrN1hGthQeCrNN2Wl2Sbbo1ODY8XoJI4HFsA9evXf_XxKyC6qp18ndXYW6-2KGpCpMpXQhmutJk-zc6vdh4iNnIB7AStno6zxA3CEY-qjIqu) [⁽⁶⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQFrBDrUcj6pZ_Lrpi38m5ZH1zOm3Qh2jaE5wVsNbJdCs4-b3_7lp7lK7qAwFFCw60sdOeydYOLB_cJmTpsd-2bgrvb7bVQxlhW05AXoPw7EYgiaz0rGjfxhInEogAQ2YB1RZcc=) [⁽⁷⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQF6XocekliXPVAZ-63WSrjGk_E7vFr1FceC-hoJD2piS3pbi9QdySyxUxh55Kow-k5KtLX69nxf76cJbOjofd90sEQe6xpC2XDajpFHyQLnOHBgQFfz7Prvxjv-_JwyGAML8OWYEB04EuiL)

On one side was the **Union**, which was the name for the northern states that wanted to keep the country together. They were led by President Abraham Lincoln, who believed that the nation must remain united. The Union[⁽⁸⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQEJOTs5ejIJvclYx_AR2hhe9fRcpQUMCpLOYzyd8aamD4veUNGNyO0--zNiticZgxQy8Hvx5el3Jln65iuHkFLTEfMHESpdz6vD-CrL-eKwqtUvEfNpmCcx1EatJIPkRlN3eRqaZyYD4jnMXL5Z-uyBhZfogTgsCChm7g==) [⁽⁹⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQFh8K-sN1oeL1BOJq5aKuQuwPpe1vAeDQ7yzOpUCENc7rXAY8AGRlaL98s1nMoYx8l6NPDfAK1qLCKko57v9OKZVSksj7MfdXjsTTwbKbeLfL_0YcJfPzMzKQAo0odOB80qna2eog8km7GO13V4rsD2umE_NWfMRYArmxq0wg==) flag was the Stars and Stripes we still know today, and they fought for the cause of unity. On the other side was the **Confederacy**, the new country formed by the southern states. They were led by President Jefferson Davis. The Confederacy[⁽⁸⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQEJOTs5ejIJvclYx_AR2hhe9fRcpQUMCpLOYzyd8aamD4veUNGNyO0--zNiticZgxQy8Hvx5el3Jln65iuHkFLTEfMHESpdz6vD-CrL-eKwqtUvEfNpmCcx1EatJIPkRlN3eRqaZyYD4jnMXL5Z-uyBhZfogTgsCChm7g==) [⁽⁹⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQFh8K-sN1oeL1BOJq5aKuQuwPpe1vAeDQ7yzOpUCENc7rXAY8AGRlaL98s1nMoYx8l6NPDfAK1qLCKko57v9OKZVSksj7MfdXjsTTwbKbeLfL_0YcJfPzMzKQAo0odOB80qna2eog8km7GO13V4rsD2umE_NWfMRYArmxq0wg==) fought for the right to govern themselves and to maintain the system of slavery.

The title "Two Countries, One Family" explains just how difficult the Civil War was for ordinary people. Even though the states were separated into two armies, the people were still one family. Neighbors and friends who had lived peacefully together for years now had to choose a side. This was most difficult in the **Border States**, like Kentucky and Missouri, which were slave states that chose to stay in the Union.

In these border states, and all across the country, families were ripped apart by the war. Sons often joined opposite armies and fought against each other on the battlefield. The division even reached the most powerful family in the country: President Abraham Lincoln’s own family. His wife, Mary Todd Lincoln, was from Kentucky, a border state. She had brothers and brothers-in-law who chose to join the Confederate army and fight against the Union. This showed how personal and heartbreaking the struggle for **freedom** and **unity** had become, proving that the Civil War was truly a fight between brothers.[⁽⁹⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQFh8K-sN1oeL1BOJq5aKuQuwPpe1vAeDQ7yzOpUCENc7rXAY8AGRlaL98s1nMoYx8l6NPDfAK1qLCKko57v9OKZVSksj7MfdXjsTTwbKbeLfL_0YcJfPzMzKQAo0odOB80qna2eog8km7GO13V4rsD2umE_NWfMRYArmxq0wg==) [⁽¹⁰⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQHtimifUEHPgPvoe9VKujOPvQ9nAC7TLmco9dOUWDMZWph7q0v3lKFej8D8NS5qRez11eXPGEDXqQDSmS27v6f3AsfhGv99EiGBVRp3x6PkOv4bA8lfzESwrtM1lZSncd9sb782XGX7Hn7zZsW4B4-PX1e_4oldyXXTEaY=) [⁽¹¹⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQHJeltQq1wYRcNhOVVRO2Dlqjc2pVTZmh7h6K-sXPujY_k_oOkyYlUMBOcMX5eLQBsOURpzBNm86gR8TyJdN_VLg1huFb19N-Iv3ol9snhv31H63s3PxCrSuIb_ntSKJ-ZLj6EL1_4bqdQ9OhtVtqmL6KEaw22_q0yI4eySlCKE7OnR) [⁽¹²⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQGhHVmCXIVE6pSvGJygRLGorazUnAVttoAsei9_K7hT6WOsqN7tz0p8yP1HG7TE0Njlkt0Ue19qfZ__lOCQOjI3SycF59YpXRmfimshn8dfI1Y-DG0BUVdpdycbeHDanBcCMbuu7V1E2FjO2OUd9ky4GNo1G_w2ndxXUZNPM7Wm4Glu1mvXtOJ5cI0gAXUUmcb1gkjBpvaenRvdSjpTM-ffSbcD_1QvCezl) [⁽¹³⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQHDZMCXtaqrk2nmNDMZMcDPXN0OK_yskLMdkeUChT5g0oSJKQb2MfL32VpoLHk4Cv8YFZ6Dr1dGnFREI38o7yDWaZbZ6uvc3shq1KyIGgKig6-DMJtYgzLQCNG_ezTFOPmSRRRprh-S-grKcLG-g5vaOXGg-dwXAVNsTAsEoejs0qU4aPwbwafmRPym5WnbodNQgq7HrfjN8xnxx8EdWlqmPEMIFmIg_njw9V0jX3UVp3OBvyXp91QPlbtW2qBxfE38PPJKajX5_NQhMeKK)

## Heroes, Hardships, and Healing: How the War Ended and Changed America

The long, difficult Civil War finally came to an end in the spring of 1865, but not with a loud final battle. The end came quietly, in a small town in Virginia called Appomattox Court House. The Confederate Army, led by General Robert E. Lee, was running low on men, food, and supplies. General Lee realized that continuing to fight would only cause more people to be hurt, so he made the difficult, honorable decision to surrender.[⁽¹⁴⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQF7MI-IVOm90RMtJ-m9HCg4JWjuf-eH9vvWZ-qXFtXoTj2J_Av6rBqSsCM90KNUIM7oUJAHbz4ZH82z9W0u-TKzlFb27uZBNyc8kGDDeUeU7p_JATtLGoPFYPtyvGUTzKvYjp_I0vxtR-z3Hyc5Ci70ZXXaeorOP7fx9buMUFPPSFJRHaEXbK6RVq9Ps8ajlXOUcg_HB8m54Qgo02bbmQ==) [⁽¹⁵⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQFGbcwQu-vg0mlk8XCGxU6bgpONAbbhohwk0dSs-fsY-oeWK5W-wUChdq_G9waa9_a15Mfj7D0yw5jyCmS9v8e2A2GULP6HdUvvgDr8WJGLhVDRunkEkLyjPV-ZOnATURAhGwzjqcHUOjM=)

On April 9, 1865, two great heroes of the war met to bring the fighting to a close. Confederate General Robert E. Lee met with Union General Ulysses S. Grant at a private home in Appomattox Court House to sign the surrender papers.[⁽¹⁶⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQF1zgqeEpx8FN3_4UrqrFFbVsKL678Txf2cboZ5cWvP0chwgeJ7RFwYGJJ8bLbLpr0NUeE266_OoGvmhoR9HKTcH_WLsNBeCavOSA4NBygNbI_4ltFseKByiM_T-0kSekhyLSta9kt9qA8Gte34s4r9T9Q3vRWn0w==) [⁽¹⁷⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQGflJzqLBdBLsJgsKDXrCFk8isT3dCu7hdna4tfii-Q52I3hElXYq0cPuvYjhcUxn744XHFGtCE5chLkDEWmBvX-j2U-wi-bpgPZvAY_m29BE1esBENDIOlbKaG335YQDTh8qf3AgwDccUsepc06X6chZe4baTjSq2g8tcJYtqHwFc=) [⁽¹⁸⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQHkjeTuad941LNFQ1KGzCCtdqBN0M9-t3TYQmqYI1aQFzpgw8vMTirwTMl-ln3_6pPj95ypeBPqeW2jvJhDRcwHHVzkDotrWa-tdJQ-qozfEaPJB5fqusCoBgxKbuSey46N3MDvfFkgPZOyjsUlLqDe0mgg210s78obXqfhWcnSt-BpaaPOncTVLmu5hFsjwJyKYEXhtufLTmoMx3AbOO_JYDcDZIncC7W8ALfRxpEaKaqDAFmi) General Grant, who was now the biggest hero for the Union, was very generous to the defeated soldiers. He did not want to punish the Confederate men. He let them keep their horses and mules, which they would need to plow their fields and farm when they returned home. He also allowed the officers to keep their sidearms, like their swords. This kindness from General Grant showed that the North and South could begin to heal and stop being enemies. The formal end of the war helped to put the nation back on the path to becoming one country again.[⁽¹⁹⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQFA9ZulwwCHkiZZw56fD4W5r7Y3qQ7Ayrgu7Y6OJwMTN7_cr8iGjQ9vANiSuvOT7ll8n3iSraRc3oiinvJs0PG_Nno03yBPwG1KQjPWBujla7Zhp9veXKMFfFHW6s8fjfn0usn9u7s=)

One of the biggest changes to come from the Union victory was the end of slavery. The long, terrible reason the war was fought was finally over. In December of 1865, the United States officially added the Thirteenth Amendment to the Constitution.[⁽²⁰⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQEWEY-6IycynxQxqmIhT8LnLKHlGqQAtyQFHnqYJyOqwWomLvZxWRoZi_EAFRe_1KuAZHwG2IWDRwK5m370_wR7koUUPhMhq08pfZoxpHHhFmklk5aYN9LcTRI7Kjp0mXb7Y7dRGlSyz14Y4IDidvE2WPKVDRvVv7C52MXlmGy47d9dC-UoXBVAnlX6owfVJGxo-uWrq69BQ-aW_H4=) [⁽²¹⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQFbWV0VxdAU95--xmXMZj3fWK32AME7j1Rav7jJYAFP-JK8GGxvvQe3rP9Wb9Gy73zo8aYWHyeLELsSfpkOUChxfGo8CxpTXN4ZuLQ5NY1fpuhwyNaPeDJAQRVZY6NlpxZVGfOUi18u49_yUKrs4A==) An amendment is like a new rule that is added to the Constitution, which is the main rulebook for the country. The Thirteenth Amendment made slavery illegal forever in every single state across the entire United States.[⁽²⁰⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQEWEY-6IycynxQxqmIhT8LnLKHlGqQAtyQFHnqYJyOqwWomLvZxWRoZi_EAFRe_1KuAZHwG2IWDRwK5m370_wR7koUUPhMhq08pfZoxpHHhFmklk5aYN9LcTRI7Kjp0mXb7Y7dRGlSyz14Y4IDidvE2WPKVDRvVv7C52MXlmGy47d9dC-UoXBVAnlX6owfVJGxo-uWrq69BQ-aW_H4=) [⁽²²⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQGxp3dqwxfBNTNcB_DJhhzsEyDdAnLda1TIFplHI2uEO-dOYTP6kk6RbeEDwsC45jNzKx9bHfS4fCiEfei-0xCvs9uTBBczoVAxpOMPnRBWQbltANYr5R_Y7Yj4HHJ5jo4=) This meant that millions of African American people who had been forced into slavery were finally free. This massive change was one of the most important outcomes of the Civil War.

After four years of war, the United States faced a time of great hardship and rebuilding. The Southern states had been the site of most of the fighting, and they suffered massive damage. Cities, towns, and factories were destroyed, and important roads and railroads were torn up or ruined.[⁽²³⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQGPV8yb1X1r-e_Zy2D8S6MS6yR51TuPgg6vYqp6tui5zu_aaiTtQRlgfbEqrS5X5KchOZQabk7zZoYoFGh4oQp1UB8HjvtOYO8AccO3scEv_ax8BPr36REozYTGbze3Q3powC-FjpLBE3nxJmaewcptuGTxyFotskUngOVhIQ==) Many farms and crops had been burned, leaving people with very little food or money. Confederate banks were also ruined, and many people were left homeless and without resources.[⁽²⁰⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQEWEY-6IycynxQxqmIhT8LnLKHlGqQAtyQFHnqYJyOqwWomLvZxWRoZi_EAFRe_1KuAZHwG2IWDRwK5m370_wR7koUUPhMhq08pfZoxpHHhFmklk5aYN9LcTRI7Kjp0mXb7Y7dRGlSyz14Y4IDidvE2WPKVDRvVv7C52MXlmGy47d9dC-UoXBVAnlX6owfVJGxo-uWrq69BQ-aW_H4=) The whole country needed a plan to bring the states back together and repair the damage.

The time right after the war is called the Reconstruction Era. The word "reconstruction" means to build something again. This period had three major goals: to bring the Southern states back into the United States government as equals, to rebuild the damaged towns and infrastructure, and to figure out how the newly freed African American citizens would live and be treated in the country.[⁽¹⁶⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQF1zgqeEpx8FN3_4UrqrFFbVsKL678Txf2cboZ5cWvP0chwgeJ7RFwYGJJ8bLbLpr0NUeE266_OoGvmhoR9HKTcH_WLsNBeCavOSA4NBygNbI_4ltFseKByiM_T-0kSekhyLSta9kt9qA8Gte34s4r9T9Q3vRWn0w==) 

The newly freed African Americans, called "freedpeople," faced many big challenges even though they were finally free. Because they had been enslaved, most had been denied the right to an education, a place to live, and money. They were now free citizens but had to start their new lives with almost nothing. The federal government had to try and help these new citizens find homes, jobs, and an education so they could become successful. However, the United States was still divided in many ways, and the road to true healing and equality for all its citizens would be a very long and hard one. The Civil War saved the United States by keeping the country together, but it took many more years to build a truly equal and fair nation.

Title: The Civil War

## Two Countries, One Family: The Fight Over Freedom and Unity

The Civil War was a fight that tore the United States apart, much like a great argument tearing a family in two. For many years, the northern states and the southern states had grown to be very different. These differences led to a terrible war where Americans were fighting against Americans. The main reason for this heartbreaking division was the issue of slavery and who had the power to make laws about it.[⁽¹⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQElcrqnoF-9zvkKNqFPU7BF-6PzP5P54TT9lZZgk-7boG_aujGeRZfm0GDPuvJ0EAyKMbNNZ_gsfQj04O--WeNVJwDSL-82siYcezQ4fH2fq6wxO4T8oxbp_56L7pfJTwR-8A0Q6W7YOtVO8UEDD4dgeGWL7m7hA2vWngBXSX-kiq8xWgIwMDSkvPpQf6CcluuiFg==) [⁽²⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQG4VAAzIQGJ3RtGvn7pYI6M6wdSj0CAFDFkTJ_iP1jOYfPFx2cZX6WYzRVP1Q1mF-v1mXxGS272fDIqcFeHvSt73_s5M74EL0RLig-MMX25WaGaPLgRsKR6sZz6lxCG-xTBNExgeEsQQbAfa7Wk1ItgSjZ4l9ohlxtoaRFgGHOQ)

The most important cause of the war was the use of enslaved people in the South. In the southern states, a vast number of enslaved people—men, women, and children—were forced to work on large farms called plantations. They worked mainly to grow crops like cotton, which made a lot of money for the plantation owners. The[⁽²⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQG4VAAzIQGJ3RtGvn7pYI6M6wdSj0CAFDFkTJ_iP1jOYfPFx2cZX6WYzRVP1Q1mF-v1mXxGS272fDIqcFeHvSt73_s5M74EL0RLig-MMX25WaGaPLgRsKR6sZz6lxCG-xTBNExgeEsQQbAfa7Wk1ItgSjZ4l9ohlxtoaRFgGHOQ) [⁽³⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQHlpu96IRWTV9j2fr4VTm7wZHV1bxguCuqau699bu3UBToxCIjS85PUuhNPrAXRVXKJCezDTqilNibA20cLWhMLl5J_REDNOsjW5O0HpWsF0SjIw4XXednE_cIHO2XQJ2ACuw==) South believed its entire way of life and its economy depended on keeping this system of enslavement. The people who were enslaved were treated like property, not as human beings with rights, and they were forced to work without pay or freedom.

In[⁽¹⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQElcrqnoF-9zvkKNqFPU7BF-6PzP5P54TT9lZZgk-7boG_aujGeRZfm0GDPuvJ0EAyKMbNNZ_gsfQj04O--WeNVJwDSL-82siYcezQ4fH2fq6wxO4T8oxbp_56L7pfJTwR-8A0Q6W7YOtVO8UEDD4dgeGWL7m7hA2vWngBXSX-kiq8xWgIwMDSkvPpQf6CcluuiFg==) the North, however, most states had outlawed slavery. People in the North were increasingly against the practice of owning another person. They believed it was morally wrong. The disagreement grew so loud and angry that it felt like two separate nations were living side-by-side. The southern states worried that the northern states and the national government would try to force them to give up slavery completely.

To protect their way of life, eleven southern states decided to take a drastic step: they chose to secede, or leave, the United States. These states—including South Carolina, Mississippi, Florida, and Texas—formed their own new country called the Confederate States of America, or the Confederacy. This act of leaving the Union is what truly started the war. The Confederacy wanted to be a new, independent country, but the United States government said they were not allowed to leave.[⁽²⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQG4VAAzIQGJ3RtGvn7pYI6M6wdSj0CAFDFkTJ_iP1jOYfPFx2cZX6WYzRVP1Q1mF-v1mXxGS272fDIqcFeHvSt73_s5M74EL0RLig-MMX25WaGaPLgRsKR6sZz6lxCG-xTBNExgeEsQQbAfa7Wk1ItgSjZ4l9ohlxtoaRFgGHOQ) [⁽⁴⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQEKkFoklHH4Ri4cAVlQFgxuQGreVISV1bM5eHD7qIbQ6HI0jLyTUxfB0z529yM9hCp0cTVJzSAFy30m5WtjaM7D7H7Nbm78hUgvxk6hFLcs67rD2EKwY5zDsuNS4hEMgyiTEo1mxKAzbCX4WmG2VPqBPdq0fGXMOAkLHnenEPcfrEs9zK1z5DBkbWx2pA==) [⁽⁵⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQH-uRweQCyStheU-wDqAIYBa1hP5CH3PrqNviwndnAqeCpwt7znbihr83i9GUBKBrN1hGthQeCrNN2Wl2Sbbo1ODY8XoJI4HFsA9evXf_XxKyC6qp18ndXYW6-2KGpCpMpXQhmutJk-zc6vdh4iNnIB7AStno6zxA3CEY-qjIqu) [⁽⁶⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQFrBDrUcj6pZ_Lrpi38m5ZH1zOm3Qh2jaE5wVsNbJdCs4-b3_7lp7lK7qAwFFCw60sdOeydYOLB_cJmTpsd-2bgrvb7bVQxlhW05AXoPw7EYgiaz0rGjfxhInEogAQ2YB1RZcc=) [⁽⁷⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQF6XocekliXPVAZ-63WSrjGk_E7vFr1FceC-hoJD2piS3pbi9QdySyxUxh55Kow-k5KtLX69nxf76cJbOjofd90sEQe6xpC2XDajpFHyQLnOHBgQFfz7Prvxjv-_JwyGAML8OWYEB04EuiL)

On one side was the **Union**, which was the name for the northern states that wanted to keep the country together. They were led by President Abraham Lincoln, who believed that the nation must remain united. The Union[⁽⁸⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQEJOTs5ejIJvclYx_AR2hhe9fRcpQUMCpLOYzyd8aamD4veUNGNyO0--zNiticZgxQy8Hvx5el3Jln65iuHkFLTEfMHESpdz6vD-CrL-eKwqtUvEfNpmCcx1EatJIPkRlN3eRqaZyYD4jnMXL5Z-uyBhZfogTgsCChm7g==) [⁽⁹⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQFh8K-sN1oeL1BOJq5aKuQuwPpe1vAeDQ7yzOpUCENc7rXAY8AGRlaL98s1nMoYx8l6NPDfAK1qLCKko57v9OKZVSksj7MfdXjsTTwbKbeLfL_0YcJfPzMzKQAo0odOB80qna2eog8km7GO13V4rsD2umE_NWfMRYArmxq0wg==) flag was the Stars and Stripes we still know today, and they fought for the cause of unity. On the other side was the **Confederacy**, the new country formed by the southern states. They were led by President Jefferson Davis. The Confederacy[⁽⁸⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQEJOTs5ejIJvclYx_AR2hhe9fRcpQUMCpLOYzyd8aamD4veUNGNyO0--zNiticZgxQy8Hvx5el3Jln65iuHkFLTEfMHESpdz6vD-CrL-eKwqtUvEfNpmCcx1EatJIPkRlN3eRqaZyYD4jnMXL5Z-uyBhZfogTgsCChm7g==) [⁽⁹⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQFh8K-sN1oeL1BOJq5aKuQuwPpe1vAeDQ7yzOpUCENc7rXAY8AGRlaL98s1nMoYx8l6NPDfAK1qLCKko57v9OKZVSksj7MfdXjsTTwbKbeLfL_0YcJfPzMzKQAo0odOB80qna2eog8km7GO13V4rsD2umE_NWfMRYArmxq0wg==) fought for the right to govern themselves and to maintain the system of slavery.

The title "Two Countries, One Family" explains just how difficult the Civil War was for ordinary people. Even though the states were separated into two armies, the people were still one family. Neighbors and friends who had lived peacefully together for years now had to choose a side. This was most difficult in the **Border States**, like Kentucky and Missouri, which were slave states that chose to stay in the Union.

In these border states, and all across the country, families were ripped apart by the war. Sons often joined opposite armies and fought against each other on the battlefield. The division even reached the most powerful family in the country: President Abraham Lincoln’s own family. His wife, Mary Todd Lincoln, was from Kentucky, a border state. She had brothers and brothers-in-law who chose to join the Confederate army and fight against the Union. This showed how personal and heartbreaking the struggle for **freedom** and **unity** had become, proving that the Civil War was truly a fight between brothers.[⁽⁹⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQFh8K-sN1oeL1BOJq5aKuQuwPpe1vAeDQ7yzOpUCENc7rXAY8AGRlaL98s1nMoYx8l6NPDfAK1qLCKko57v9OKZVSksj7MfdXjsTTwbKbeLfL_0YcJfPzMzKQAo0odOB80qna2eog8km7GO13V4rsD2umE_NWfMRYArmxq0wg==) [⁽¹⁰⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQHtimifUEHPgPvoe9VKujOPvQ9nAC7TLmco9dOUWDMZWph7q0v3lKFej8D8NS5qRez11eXPGEDXqQDSmS27v6f3AsfhGv99EiGBVRp3x6PkOv4bA8lfzESwrtM1lZSncd9sb782XGX7Hn7zZsW4B4-PX1e_4oldyXXTEaY=) [⁽¹¹⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQHJeltQq1wYRcNhOVVRO2Dlqjc2pVTZmh7h6K-sXPujY_k_oOkyYlUMBOcMX5eLQBsOURpzBNm86gR8TyJdN_VLg1huFb19N-Iv3ol9snhv31H63s3PxCrSuIb_ntSKJ-ZLj6EL1_4bqdQ9OhtVtqmL6KEaw22_q0yI4eySlCKE7OnR) [⁽¹²⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQGhHVmCXIVE6pSvGJygRLGorazUnAVttoAsei9_K7hT6WOsqN7tz0p8yP1HG7TE0Njlkt0Ue19qfZ__lOCQOjI3SycF59YpXRmfimshn8dfI1Y-DG0BUVdpdycbeHDanBcCMbuu7V1E2FjO2OUd9ky4GNo1G_w2ndxXUZNPM7Wm4Glu1mvXtOJ5cI0gAXUUmcb1gkjBpvaenRvdSjpTM-ffSbcD_1QvCezl) [⁽¹³⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQHDZMCXtaqrk2nmNDMZMcDPXN0OK_yskLMdkeUChT5g0oSJKQb2MfL32VpoLHk4Cv8YFZ6Dr1dGnFREI38o7yDWaZbZ6uvc3shq1KyIGgKig6-DMJtYgzLQCNG_ezTFOPmSRRRprh-S-grKcLG-g5vaOXGg-dwXAVNsTAsEoejs0qU4aPwbwafmRPym5WnbodNQgq7HrfjN8xnxx8EdWlqmPEMIFmIg_njw9V0jX3UVp3OBvyXp91QPlbtW2qBxfE38PPJKajX5_NQhMeKK)

## Heroes, Hardships, and Healing: How the War Ended and Changed America

The long, difficult Civil War finally came to an end in the spring of 1865, but not with a loud final battle. The end came quietly, in a small town in Virginia called Appomattox Court House. The Confederate Army, led by General Robert E. Lee, was running low on men, food, and supplies. General Lee realized that continuing to fight would only cause more people to be hurt, so he made the difficult, honorable decision to surrender.[⁽¹⁴⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQF7MI-IVOm90RMtJ-m9HCg4JWjuf-eH9vvWZ-qXFtXoTj2J_Av6rBqSsCM90KNUIM7oUJAHbz4ZH82z9W0u-TKzlFb27uZBNyc8kGDDeUeU7p_JATtLGoPFYPtyvGUTzKvYjp_I0vxtR-z3Hyc5Ci70ZXXaeorOP7fx9buMUFPPSFJRHaEXbK6RVq9Ps8ajlXOUcg_HB8m54Qgo02bbmQ==) [⁽¹⁵⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQFGbcwQu-vg0mlk8XCGxU6bgpONAbbhohwk0dSs-fsY-oeWK5W-wUChdq_G9waa9_a15Mfj7D0yw5jyCmS9v8e2A2GULP6HdUvvgDr8WJGLhVDRunkEkLyjPV-ZOnATURAhGwzjqcHUOjM=)

On April 9, 1865, two great heroes of the war met to bring the fighting to a close. Confederate General Robert E. Lee met with Union General Ulysses S. Grant at a private home in Appomattox Court House to sign the surrender papers.[⁽¹⁶⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQF1zgqeEpx8FN3_4UrqrFFbVsKL678Txf2cboZ5cWvP0chwgeJ7RFwYGJJ8bLbLpr0NUeE266_OoGvmhoR9HKTcH_WLsNBeCavOSA4NBygNbI_4ltFseKByiM_T-0kSekhyLSta9kt9qA8Gte34s4r9T9Q3vRWn0w==) [⁽¹⁷⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQGflJzqLBdBLsJgsKDXrCFk8isT3dCu7hdna4tfii-Q52I3hElXYq0cPuvYjhcUxn744XHFGtCE5chLkDEWmBvX-j2U-wi-bpgPZvAY_m29BE1esBENDIOlbKaG335YQDTh8qf3AgwDccUsepc06X6chZe4baTjSq2g8tcJYtqHwFc=) [⁽¹⁸⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQHkjeTuad941LNFQ1KGzCCtdqBN0M9-t3TYQmqYI1aQFzpgw8vMTirwTMl-ln3_6pPj95ypeBPqeW2jvJhDRcwHHVzkDotrWa-tdJQ-qozfEaPJB5fqusCoBgxKbuSey46N3MDvfFkgPZOyjsUlLqDe0mgg210s78obXqfhWcnSt-BpaaPOncTVLmu5hFsjwJyKYEXhtufLTmoMx3AbOO_JYDcDZIncC7W8ALfRxpEaKaqDAFmi) General Grant, who was now the biggest hero for the Union, was very generous to the defeated soldiers. He did not want to punish the Confederate men. He let them keep their horses and mules, which they would need to plow their fields and farm when they returned home. He also allowed the officers to keep their sidearms, like their swords. This kindness from General Grant showed that the North and South could begin to heal and stop being enemies. The formal end of the war helped to put the nation back on the path to becoming one country again.[⁽¹⁹⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQFA9ZulwwCHkiZZw56fD4W5r7Y3qQ7Ayrgu7Y6OJwMTN7_cr8iGjQ9vANiSuvOT7ll8n3iSraRc3oiinvJs0PG_Nno03yBPwG1KQjPWBujla7Zhp9veXKMFfFHW6s8fjfn0usn9u7s=)

One of the biggest changes to come from the Union victory was the end of slavery. The long, terrible reason the war was fought was finally over. In December of 1865, the United States officially added the Thirteenth Amendment to the Constitution.[⁽²⁰⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQEWEY-6IycynxQxqmIhT8LnLKHlGqQAtyQFHnqYJyOqwWomLvZxWRoZi_EAFRe_1KuAZHwG2IWDRwK5m370_wR7koUUPhMhq08pfZoxpHHhFmklk5aYN9LcTRI7Kjp0mXb7Y7dRGlSyz14Y4IDidvE2WPKVDRvVv7C52MXlmGy47d9dC-UoXBVAnlX6owfVJGxo-uWrq69BQ-aW_H4=) [⁽²¹⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQFbWV0VxdAU95--xmXMZj3fWK32AME7j1Rav7jJYAFP-JK8GGxvvQe3rP9Wb9Gy73zo8aYWHyeLELsSfpkOUChxfGo8CxpTXN4ZuLQ5NY1fpuhwyNaPeDJAQRVZY6NlpxZVGfOUi18u49_yUKrs4A==) An amendment is like a new rule that is added to the Constitution, which is the main rulebook for the country. The Thirteenth Amendment made slavery illegal forever in every single state across the entire United States.[⁽²⁰⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQEWEY-6IycynxQxqmIhT8LnLKHlGqQAtyQFHnqYJyOqwWomLvZxWRoZi_EAFRe_1KuAZHwG2IWDRwK5m370_wR7koUUPhMhq08pfZoxpHHhFmklk5aYN9LcTRI7Kjp0mXb7Y7dRGlSyz14Y4IDidvE2WPKVDRvVv7C52MXlmGy47d9dC-UoXBVAnlX6owfVJGxo-uWrq69BQ-aW_H4=) [⁽²²⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQGxp3dqwxfBNTNcB_DJhhzsEyDdAnLda1TIFplHI2uEO-dOYTP6kk6RbeEDwsC45jNzKx9bHfS4fCiEfei-0xCvs9uTBBczoVAxpOMPnRBWQbltANYr5R_Y7Yj4HHJ5jo4=) This meant that millions of African American people who had been forced into slavery were finally free. This massive change was one of the most important outcomes of the Civil War.

After four years of war, the United States faced a time of great hardship and rebuilding. The Southern states had been the site of most of the fighting, and they suffered massive damage. Cities, towns, and factories were destroyed, and important roads and railroads were torn up or ruined.[⁽²³⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQGPV8yb1X1r-e_Zy2D8S6MS6yR51TuPgg6vYqp6tui5zu_aaiTtQRlgfbEqrS5X5KchOZQabk7zZoYoFGh4oQp1UB8HjvtOYO8AccO3scEv_ax8BPr36REozYTGbze3Q3powC-FjpLBE3nxJmaewcptuGTxyFotskUngOVhIQ==) Many farms and crops had been burned, leaving people with very little food or money. Confederate banks were also ruined, and many people were left homeless and without resources.[⁽²⁰⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQEWEY-6IycynxQxqmIhT8LnLKHlGqQAtyQFHnqYJyOqwWomLvZxWRoZi_EAFRe_1KuAZHwG2IWDRwK5m370_wR7koUUPhMhq08pfZoxpHHhFmklk5aYN9LcTRI7Kjp0mXb7Y7dRGlSyz14Y4IDidvE2WPKVDRvVv7C52MXlmGy47d9dC-UoXBVAnlX6owfVJGxo-uWrq69BQ-aW_H4=) The whole country needed a plan to bring the states back together and repair the damage.

The time right after the war is called the Reconstruction Era. The word "reconstruction" means to build something again. This period had three major goals: to bring the Southern states back into the United States government as equals, to rebuild the damaged towns and infrastructure, and to figure out how the newly freed African American citizens would live and be treated in the country.[⁽¹⁶⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQF1zgqeEpx8FN3_4UrqrFFbVsKL678Txf2cboZ5cWvP0chwgeJ7RFwYGJJ8bLbLpr0NUeE266_OoGvmhoR9HKTcH_WLsNBeCavOSA4NBygNbI_4ltFseKByiM_T-0kSekhyLSta9kt9qA8Gte34s4r9T9Q3vRWn0w==) ⁽²⁴⁾ ⁽²⁵⁾

The newly freed African Americans, called "freedpeople," faced many big challenges even though they were finally free. Because they had been enslaved, most had been denied the right to an education, a place to live, and money.⁽²⁶⁾ They were now free citizens but had to start their new lives with almost nothing. The federal government had to try and help these new citizens find homes, jobs, and an education so they could become successful. However, the United States was still divided in many ways, and the road to true healing and equality for all its citizens would be a very long and hard one. The Civil War saved the United States by keeping the country together, but it took many more years to build a truly equal and fair nation.

history.data:
Title: The Civil War

## Two Countries, One Family: The Fight Over Freedom and Unity

The Civil War was a big fight. This fight broke the United States into two pieces. It was like a huge argument that split one family. For many years, the northern states and the southern states were very different. These differences led to a terrible war. Americans were fighting against other Americans.

The main reason for this sad fight was slavery. The states also argued about who could make rules about slavery [⁽¹⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQElcrqnoF-9zvkKNqFPU7BF-6PzP5P54TT9lZZgk-7boG_aujGeRZfm0GDPuvJ0EAyKMbNNZ_gsfQj04O--WeNVJwDSL-82siYcezQ4fH2fq6wxO4T8oxbp_56L7pfJTwR-8A0Q6W7YOtVO8UEDD4dgeGWL7m7hA2vWngBXSX-kiq8xWgIwMDSkvPpQf6CcluuiFg==) [⁽²⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQG4VAAzIQGJ3RtGvn7pYI6M6wdSj0CAFDFkTJ_iP1jOYfPFx2cZX6WYzRVP1Q1mF-v1mXxGS272fDIqcFeHvSt73_s5M74EL0RLig-MMX25WaGaPLgRsKR6sZz6lxCG-xTBNExgeEsQQbAfa7Wk1ItgSjZ4l9ohlxtoaRFgGHOQ).

The biggest cause of the war was the use of enslaved people in the South. Many people—kids, women, and men—were forced to work [⁽²⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQG4VAAzIQGJ3RtGvn7pYI6M6wdSj0CAFDFkTJ_iP1jOYfPFx2cZX6WYzRVP1Q1mF-v1mXxGS272fDIqcFeHvSt73_s5M74EL0RLig-MMX25WaGaPLgRsKR6sZz6lxCG-xTBNExgeEsQQbAfa7Wk1ItgSjZ4l9ohlxtoaRFgGHOQ). They worked on very big farms called plantations. They grew crops like cotton [⁽³⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQHlpu96IRWTV9j2fr4VTm7wZHV1bxguCuqau699bu3UBToxCIjS85PUuhNPrAXRVXKJCezDTqilNibA20cLWhMLl5J_REDNOsjW5O0HpWsF0SjIw4XXednE_cIHO2XQJ2ACuw==). This cotton made the farm owners rich.

The South felt their whole life needed slavery. They thought their money and farms would stop without it. People who were enslaved were treated badly. They were seen as property, like a chair or a tool. They were forced to work without pay or freedom.

The North was different [⁽¹⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQElcrqnoF-9zvkKNqFPU7BF-6PzP5P54TT9lZZgk-7boG_aujGeRZfm0GDPuvJ0EAyKMbNNZ_gsfQj04O--WeNVJwDSL-82siYcezQ4fH2fq6wxO4T8oxbp_56L7pfJTwR-8A0Q6W7YOtVO8UEDD4dgeGWL7m7hA2vWngBXSX-kiq8xWgIwMDSkvPpQf6CcluuiFg==). Most states in the North made slavery illegal. People in the North thought owning another person was very wrong. They felt it was bad in their hearts. The disagreement between the states grew very loud and angry.

The southern states worried about the North. They worried the government would make them stop slavery. To protect their way of life, eleven southern states decided to leave the United States. This is called secession, or leaving.

These states included South Carolina, Mississippi, Florida, and Texas. They started their own new country. They called it the Confederate States of America, or the Confederacy. This leaving is what truly started the war. The Confederacy wanted to be a new, separate country [⁽²⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQG4VAAzIQGJ3RtGvn7pYI6M6wdSj0CAFDFkTJ_iP1jOYfPFx2cZX6WYzRVP1Q1mF-v1mXxGS272fDIqcFeHvSt73_s5M74EL0RLig-MMX25WaGaPLgRsKR6sZz6lxCG-xTBNExgeEsQQbAfa7Wk1ItgSjZ4l9ohlxtoaRFgGHOQ) [⁽⁴⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQEKkFoklHH4Ri4cAVlQFgxuQGreVISV1bM5eHD7qIbQ6HI0jLyTUxfB0z529yM9hCp0cTVJzSAFy30m5WtjaM7D7H7Nbm78hUgvxk6hFLcs67rD2EKwY5zDsuNS4hEMgyiTEo1mxKAzbCX4WmG2VPqBPdq0fGXMOAkLHnenEPcfrEs9zK1z5DBkbWx2pA==) [⁽⁵⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQH-uRweQCyStheU-wDqAIYBa1hP5CH3PrqNviwndnAqeCpwt7znbihr83i9GUBKBrN1hGthQeCrNN2Wl2Sbbo1ODY8XoJI4HFsA9evXf_XxKyC6qp18ndXYW6-2KGpCpMpXQhmutJk-zc6vdh4iNnIB7AStno6zxA3CEY-qjIqu) [⁽⁶⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQFrBDrUcj6pZ_Lrpi38m5ZH1zOm3Qh2jaE5wVsNbJdCs4-b3_7lp7lK7qAwFFCw60sdOeydYOLB_cJmTpsd-2bgrvb7bVQxlhW05AXoPw7EYgiaz0rGjfxhInEogAQ2YB1RZcc=) [⁽⁷⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQF6XocekliXPVAZ-63WSrjGk_E7vFr1FceC-hoJD2piS3pbi9QdySyxUxh55Kow-k5KtLX69nxf76cJbOjofd90sEQe6xpC2XDajpFHyQLnOHBgQFfz7Prvxjv-_JwyGAML8OWYEB04EuiL). But the United States government said they must stay.

One side was the **Union**. This was the name for the northern states. They wanted to keep the whole country together. President Abraham Lincoln led the Union [⁽⁸⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQEJOTs5ejIJvclYx_AR2hhe9fRcpQUMCpLOYzyd8aamD4veUNGNyO0--zNiticZgxQy8Hvx5el3Jln65iuHkFLTEfMHESpdz6vD-CrL-eKwqtUvEfNpmCcx1EatJIPkRlN3eRqaZyYD4jnMXL5Z-uyBhZfogTgsCChm7g==) [⁽⁹⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQFh8K-sN1oeL1BOJq5aKuQuwPpe1vAeDQ7yzOpUCENc7rXAY8AGRlaL98s1nMoYx8l6NPDfAK1qLCKko57v9OKZVSksj7MfdzjsTTwbKbeLfL_0YcJfPzMzKQAo0odOB80qna2eog8km7GO13V4rsD2umE_NWfMRYArmxq0wg==). He believed the nation must stay united. The Union flag was the Stars and Stripes we know today.

The other side was the **Confederacy**. This was the new country made by the South. President Jefferson Davis led the Confederacy. The Confederacy fought for two things. They wanted to rule themselves. They also wanted to keep slavery [⁽⁸⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQEJOTs5ejIJvclYx_AR2hhe9fRcpQUMCpLOYzyd8aamD4veUNGNyO0--zNiticZgxQy8Hvx5el3Jln65iuHkFLTEfMHESpdz6vD-CrL-eKwqtUvEfNpmCcx1EatJIPkRlN3eRqaZyYD4jnMXL5Z-uyBhZfogTgsCChm7g==) [⁽⁹⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQFh8K-sN1oeL1BOJq5aKuQuwPpe1vAeDQ7yzOpUCENc7rXAY8AGRlaL98s1nMoYx8l6NPDfAK1qLCKko57v9OKZVSksj7MfdzjsTTwbKbeLfL_0YcJfPzMzKQAo0odOB80qna2eog8km7GO13V4rsD2umE_NWfMRYArmxq0wg==).

The title "Two Countries, One Family" tells us how sad the Civil War was. The states were separated into two armies. But the people were still one family. Friends and neighbors suddenly had to choose a side.

This was hardest in the **Border States**. These were states that had slavery but stayed with the Union. Kentucky and Missouri were Border States.

The war tore many families apart. Sons often joined different armies. They fought against their own brothers on the battlefield. Even President Lincoln’s family was split [⁽⁹⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQFh8K-sN1oeL1BOJq5aKuQuwPpe1vAeDQ7yzOpUCENc7rXAY8AGRlaL98s1nMoYx8l6NPDfAK1qLCKko57v9OKZVSksj7MfdzjsTTwbKbeLfL_0YcJfPzMzKQAo0odOB80qna2eog8km7GO13V4rsD2umE_NWfMRYArmxq0wg==) [⁽¹⁰⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQHtimifUEHPgPvoe9VKujOPvQ9nAC7TLmco9dOUWDMZWph7q0v3lKFej8D8NS5qRez11eXPGEDXqQDSmS27v6f3AsfhGv99EiGBVRp3x6PkOv4bA8lfzESwrtM1lZSncd9sb782XGX7Hn7zZsW4B4-PX1e_4oldyXXTEaY=). His wife, Mary Todd Lincoln, was from a Border State. She had brothers who joined the Confederate army [⁽¹¹⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQHJeltQq1wYRcNhOVVRO2Dlqjc2pVTZmh7h6K-sXPujY_k_oOkyYlUMBOcMX5eLQBsOURpzBNm86gR8TyJdN_VLg1huFb19N-Iv3ol9snhv31H63s3PxCrSuIb_ntSKJ-ZLj6EL1_4bqdQ9OhtVtqmL6KEaw22_q0yI4eySlCKE7OnR). They fought against Lincoln and the Union [⁽¹²⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQGhHVmCXIVE6pSvGJygRLGorazUnAVttoAsei9_K7hT6WOsqN7tz0p8yP1HG7TE0Njlkt0Ue19qfZ__lOCQOjI3SycF59YpXRmfimshn8dfI1Y-DG0BUVdpdycbeHDanBcCMbuu7V1E2FjO2OUd9ky4GNo1G_w2ndxXUZNPM7Wm4Glu1mvXtOJ5cI0gAXUUmcb1gkjBpvaenRvdSjpTM-ffSbcD_1QvCezl). This showed how painful the fight was. The Civil War was truly a fight between brothers for **freedom** and **unity** [⁽⁹⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQFh8K-sN1oeL1BOJq5aKuQuwPpe1vAeDQ7yzOpUCENc7rXAY8AGRlaL98s1nMoYx8l6NPDfAK1qLCKko57v9OKZVSksj7MfdzjsTTwbKbeLfL_0YcJfPzMzKQAo0odOB80qna2eog8km7GO13V4rsD2umE_NWfMRYArmxq0wg==) [⁽¹³⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQHDZMCXtaqrk2nmNDMZMcDPXN0OK_yskLMdkeUChT5g0oSJKQb2MfL32VpoLHk4Cv8YFZ6Dr1dGnFREI38o7yDWaZbZ6uvc3shq1KyIGgKig6-DMJtYgzLQCNG_ezTFOPmSRRRprh-S-grKcLG-g5vaOXGg-dwXAVNsTAsEoejs0qU4aPwbwafmRPym5WnbodNQgq7HrfjN8xnxx8EdWlqmPEMIFmIg_njw9V0jX3UVp3OBvyXp91QPlbtW2qBxfE38PPJKajX5_NQhMeKK).

## Heroes, Hardships, and Healing: How the War Ended and Changed America

The big, hard Civil War finally stopped in the spring of 1865. It did not end with a loud battle. The fighting ended quietly in a small town in Virginia. This town was called Appomattox Court House. General Robert E. Lee led the Confederate Army. His army ran out of men, food, and supplies. General Lee knew fighting more would only hurt more people. He made a hard, good choice to quit fighting, which is called surrendering. [⁽¹⁴⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQF7MI-IVOm90RMtJ-m9HCg4JWjuf-eH9vvWZ-qXFtXoTj2J_Av6rBqSsCM90KNUIM7oUJAHbz4ZH82z9W0u-TKzlFb27uZBNyc8kGDDeUeU7p_JATtLGoPFYPtyvGUTzKvYjp_I0vxtR-z3Hyc5Ci70ZXXaeorOP7fx9buMUFPPSFJRHaEXbK6RVr9Ps8ajlXOUcg_HB8m54Qgo02bbmQ==) [⁽¹⁵⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQFGbcwQu-vg0mlk8XCGxU6bgpONAbbhohwk0dSs-fsY-oeWK5W-wUChdq_G9waa9_a15Mfj7D0yw5jyCmS9v8e2A2GULP6HdUvvgDr8WJGLhVDRunkEkLyjPV-ZOnATURAhGwzjqcHUOjM=)

On April 9, 1865, two important generals met. They met to stop the war. Confederate General Robert E. Lee met Union General Ulysses S. Grant. They met in a house in Appomattox Court House to sign the papers. [⁽¹⁶⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQF1zgqeEpx8FN3_4UrqrFFbVsKL678Txf2cboZ5cWvP0chwgeJ7RFwYGJJ8bLbLpr0NUeE266_OoGvmhoR9HKTcH_WLsNBeCavOSA4NBygNbI_4ltFseKByiM_T-0kSekhyLSta9kt9qA8Gte34s4r9T9Q3vRWn0w==) [⁽¹⁷⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQGflJzqLBdBLsJgsKDXrCFk8isT3dCu7hdna4tfii-Q52I3hElXYq0cPuvYjhcUxn744XHFGtCE5chLkDEWmBvX-j2U-wi-bpgPZvAY_m29BE1esBENDIOlbKaG335YQDTh8qf3AgwDccUsepc06X6chZe4baTjSq2g8tcJYtqHwFc=) [⁽¹⁸⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQHkjeTuad941LNFQ1KGzCCtdqBN0M9-t3TYQmqYI1aQFzpgw8vMTirwTMl-ln3_6pPj95ypeBPqeW2jvJhDRcwHHVzkDotrWa-tdJQ-qozfEaPJB5fqusCoBgxKbuSey46N3MDvfFkgPZOyjsUlLqDe0mgg210s78obXqfhWcnSt-BpaaPOncTVLmu5hFsjwJyKYEXhtufLTmoMx3AbOO_JYDcDZIncC7W8ALfRxpEaKaqDAFmi)

General Grant was the Union hero. He was very kind to the soldiers who lost. He did not want to punish the Confederate men. He let them keep their horses and mules. They needed these animals to plow their fields and farm at home. He also let the officers keep their sidearms, like their swords. This kind act by General Grant showed that the North and South could start to feel better. They could stop being enemies. The war officially ending helped the nation become one country again. [⁽¹⁹⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQFA9ZulwwCHkiZZw56fD4W5r7Y3qQ7Ayrgu7Y6OJwMTN7_cr8iGjQ9vANiSuvOT7ll8n3iSraRc3oiinvJs0PG_Nno03yBPwG1KQjPWBujla7Zhp9veXKMFfFHW6s8fjfn0usn7u7s=)

The Union winning brought the end of slavery. This was the biggest change from the war. The terrible reason the war was fought finally ended. In December 1865, the United States added the Thirteenth Amendment. [⁽²⁰⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQEWEY-6IycynxQxqmIhT8LnLKHlGqQAtyQFHnqYJyOqwWomLvZxWRoZi_EAFRe_1KuAZHwG2IWDRwK5m370_wR7koUUPhMhq08pfZoxpHHhFmklk5aYN9LcTRI7Kjp0mXb7Y7dRGlSyz14Y4IDidvE2WPKVDRvVv7C52MXlmGy47d9dC-UoXBVAnlX6owfVJGxo-uWrq69BQ-aW_H4=) [⁽²¹⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQFbWV0VxdAU95--xmXMZj3fWK32AME7j1Rav7jJYAFP-JK8GGxvvQe3rP9Wb9Gy73zo8aYWHyeLELsSfpkOUChxfGo8CxpTXN4ZuLQ5NYn1fpuhwyNaPeDJAQRVZY6NlpxZVGfOUi18u49_yUKrs4A==) An amendment is like a new rule. They added this rule to the Constitution. The Constitution is the main rulebook for the country.

The Thirteenth Amendment said slavery was illegal forever. [⁽²⁰⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQEWEY-6IycynxQxqmIhT8LnLKHlGqQAtyQFHnqYJyOqwWomLvZxWRoZi_EAFRe_1KuAZHwG2IWDRwK5m370_wR7koUUPhMhq08pfZoxpHHhFmklk5aYN9LcTRI7Kjp0mXb7Y7dRGlSyz14Y4IDidvE2WPKVDRvVv7C52MXlmGy47d9dC-UoXBVAnlX6owfVJGxo-uWrq69BQ-aW_H4=) [⁽²²⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQGxp3dqwxfBNTNcB_DJhhzsEyDdAnLda1TIFplHI2uEO-dOYTP6kk6RbeEDwsC45jNzKx9bHfS4fCiEfei-0xCvs9uTBBczoVAxpOMPnRBWQbltANYr5R_Y7Yj4HHJ5jo4=) This happened in every single state in the United States. Millions of African American people had been forced to be slaves. They were finally free because of this rule. This huge change was one of the most important things that came from the Civil War.

The United States faced a difficult time after four years of war. They had to rebuild everything. The Southern states were hurt the most because most fighting happened there. They had massive damage. Cities, towns, and factories were destroyed. Important roads and train tracks were torn up or ruined. [⁽²³⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQGPV8yb1X1r-e_Zy2D8S6MS6yR51TuPgg6vYqp6tui5zu_aaiTtQRlgfbEqrS5X5KchOZQabk7zZoYoFGh4oQp1UB8HjvtOYO8AccO3scEv_ax8BPr36REozYTGbze3Q3powC-FjpLBE3nxJmaewcptuGTxyFotskUngOVhIQ==)

Many farms and crops were burned down. People had very little food or money left. Banks in the South were also ruined. [⁽²⁰⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQEWEY-6IycynxQxqmIhT8LnLKHlGqQAtyQFHnqYJyOqwWomLvZxWRoZi_EAFRe_1KuAZHwG2IWDRwK5m370_wR7koUUPhMhq08pfZoxpHHhFmklk5aYN9LcTRI7Kjp0mXb7Y7dRGlSyz14Y4IDidvE2WPKVDRvVv7C52MXlmGy47d9dC-UoXBVAnlX6owfVJGxo-uWrq69BQ-aW_H4=) Many people did not have homes or things they needed. The whole country needed a plan. They had to bring the states back together. They had to fix all the damage.

The time right after the war is called the Reconstruction Era. "Reconstruction" means you build something again. This time had three main goals. First, the South had to become part of the United States government again, as equals. [⁽¹⁶⁾](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQF1zgqeEpx8FN3_4UrqrFFbVsKL678Txf2cboZ5cWvP0chwgeJ7RFwYGJJ8bLbLpr0NUeE266_OoGvmhoR9HKTcH_WLsNBeCavOSA4NBygNbI_4ltFseKByiM_T-0kSekhyLSta9kt9qA8Gte34s4r9T9Q3vRWn0w==) Second, the damaged towns and buildings had to be fixed. Third, they had to figure out how the newly freed African American people would live. They needed to know how the country would treat these new citizens. 

The newly free African Americans were called "freedpeople." They faced many big problems, even though they were free. When they were enslaved, they could not go to school. They did not have homes or money of their own. They were free citizens now. But they had to start their new lives with almost nothing.

The government had to try and help these new citizens. They needed to find them homes, jobs, and schools. They wanted the freedpeople to be successful. However, the United States was still divided in many ways. Getting true healing and fairness for everyone was very hard. It took a very long time. The Civil War kept the country together. But it took many more years to build a country that was truly fair and equal for everyone.
